rounds.event: Swiss tennis player Roger Federer becomes the No. 1 ranked men's singles player, a position he will hold for a record 237 weeks.
deaths: Bernard McEveety, American director and producer

rounds.event: Leonarde Keeler administers polygraph tests to two murder suspects, the first time polygraph evidence was admitted in U.S. courts.
births: Evgeny Velikhov, Russian physicist and academic

rounds.event: The Osvald Group is responsible for the first, active event of anti-Nazi resistance in Norway, to protest the inauguration of Vidkun Quisling.
births: Graham Nash, English-American singer-songwriter and guitarist
deaths: Ado Birk, Estonian lawyer and politician, 3rd Prime Minister of Estonia
Daniil Kharms, Russian poet and playwright

rounds.event: The Detroit Red Wings played in the first outdoor hockey game by any NHL team in an exhibition against the Marquette Branch Prison Pirates in Marquette, Michigan.
births: Christie Brinkley, American actress, model, and businesswoman
Hansi Hinterseer, Austrian skier and actor
deaths: Hella Wuolijoki, Estonian-Finnish author and politician

rounds.event: The uprising called the "pork mutiny" starts in the region between Kuolajärvi and Savukoski in Finland.
births: Kunwar Digvijay Singh, Indian field hockey player
James L. Usry, American politician, first African-American mayor of Atlantic City, New Jersey
